title: DSC Configuration get command result
description: Represents the data structure returned by the `dsc config get` command.

results.title: Results
results.description: The results of the `get` method for every DSC Resource instance in the DSC Configuration Document with the instance's name and type.

configurationDocumentResult.json.title: Configuration result metadata
configurationDocumentResult.json.description: Defines metadata DSC returns for a configuration operation, as from the `dsc config get` or `dsc config set` commands. The metadata properties under the `Microsoft.DSC` property describe the context of the operation.
configurationDocumentResult.json.markdownDescription:
Defines metadata DSC returns for a configuration operation, as from the `dsc config get` or
`dsc config set` commands. The metadata properties under the `Microsoft.DSC` property describe
the context of the operation.

Microsoft.DSC.title: DSC context metadata
Microsoft.DSC.description: The child properties for this metadata describe the context of a DSC operation, including the version of DSC used, when the operation started and ended, and the security context the operation was invoked under.

version.json.title: DSC Version
version.json.description: Defines the version of DSC that ran the command. This value is always the semantic version of the DSC command, like `3.0.0-preview.7`.
version.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the version of DSC that ran the command. This value is always the semantic version of the
DSC command, like `3.0.0-preview.7`.

operation.json.title: Operation
operation.json.description: Defines the operation that DSC applied to the configuration document: `Get`, `Set`, `Test`, or `Export`.
operation.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the operation that DSC applied to the configuration document: `Get`, `Set`, `Test`, or
`Export`.

executionType.json.title: Execution type
executionType.json.description: Defines whether DSC actually applied an operation to the configuration or was run in `WhatIf` mode. This property is always `Actual` for `Get`, `Test`, and `Export` operations. For `Set` operations, this value is `WhatIf` when DSC is invoked with the `--whatIf` argument.
executionType.json.markdownDescription:
Defines whether DSC actually applied an operation to the configuration or was run in `WhatIf`
mode. This property is always `Actual` for `Get`, `Test`, and `Export` operations. For `Set`
operations, this value is `WhatIf` when DSC is invoked with the `--whatIf` argument.

startDatetime.json.title: Start date and time
startDatetime.json.description: Defines the start date and time for the DSC operation as a timestamp following the format defined in RFC3339, section 5.6 as `date-time`, like `2024-04-14T08:49:51.395686600-07:00`.
startDatetime.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the start date and time for the DSC operation as a timestamp following the format defined
in [RFC3339, section 5.6 (see `date-time`)][01].

For example: `2024-04-14T08:49:51.395686600-07:00`

[01]: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6

endDatetime.json.title: Start date and time
endDatetime.json.description: Defines the end date and time for the DSC operation as a timestamp following the format defined in RFC3339, section 5.6 as `date-time`, like `2024-04-14T08:49:51.395686600-07:00`.
endDatetime.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the end date and time for the DSC operation as a timestamp following the format defined
in [RFC3339, section 5.6 (see `date-time`)][01].

For example: `2024-04-14T08:49:51.395686600-07:00`

[01]: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6

duration.json.title: Duration
duration.json.description: Defines the duration of a DSC operation against a configuration document or resource instance as a string following the format defined in ISO8601 ABNF for `duration`. For example, `PT0.611216S` represents a duration of about `0.61` seconds. For more information, see: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#appendix-A
duration.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the duration of a DSC operation against a configuration document or resource instance as
a string following the format defined in [ISO8601 ABNF for `duration`][01]. For example,
`PT0.611216S` represents a duration of about `0.61` seconds.

[01]: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#appendix-A

securityContext.json.title: Security context
securityContext.json.description: Defines the security context that DSC was run under. If the value for this metadata property is `Elevated`, DSC was run as root (non-Windows) or an elevated session with Administrator privileges (on Windows). If the value is `Restricted`, DSC was run as a normal user or account in a non-elevated session.
securityContext.json.markdownDescription:
Defines the security context that DSC was run under. If the value for this metadata property is
`Elevated`, DSC was run as `root` (non-Windows) or an elevated session with Administrator
privileges (on Windows). If the value is `Restricted`, DSC was run as a normal user or account in
a non-elevated session.

resourceInstanceResult.json.title: Resource instance result metadata
resourceInstanceResult.json.description: Defines metadata DSC returns for a DSC configuration operation against a resource instance in a configuration document, as from the `dsc config get` or `dsc config set` commands. The metadata properties under the `Microsoft.DSC` property describe the context of the operation.
resourceInstanceResult.json.markdownDescription:
Defines metadata DSC returns for a configuration operation, as from the `dsc config get` or
`dsc config set` commands. The metadata properties under the `Microsoft.DSC` property describe
the context of the operation.

Microsoft.DSC.title: DSC context metadata
Microsoft.DSC.description: The child properties for this metadata describe the context of the DSC operation against a resource instance, including the duration of the operation.

get.full.json.title: dsc resource get result (full)
get.full.json.description:
Describes the return data for the full result of the `get` operation for a
resource instance. This data is returned:

- For every instance in a configuration document when you use the
  `dsc config get` command.

- For nested instances of a group or adapter resource when you use the
  `dsc resource get` command.

get.json.title: dsc resource get result
get.json.description: Describes the return data for a DSC Resource instance from the `dsc resource get` command. The return data is either a single object that describes the actual state of a non-nested instance or an array of objects that describe the actual state of the nested instances for a group or adapter resource.

get.simple.json.title: dsc resource get result (simple)
get.simple.json.description:
Describes the return data for a single DSC Resource instance from the `dsc resource get` command. This data is returned for instances that aren't group resources, adapter resources, or nested inside a group or adapter resource.
When you use `dsc resource get` for a group or adapter resource, the command returns an array of full test result objects that include the name and type for the nested instances.

actualState.title: Actual state
actualState.description: This property always represents the current state of the DSC Resource instance as returned by its `get` method. DSC validates this return value against the DSC Resource's schema.

messages.json.title: Messages
messages.json.description: A list of structured messages emitted by the DSC Resources during an operation.

hadErrors.json.title: Had Errors
hadErrors.json.description: Indicates whether any of the DSC Resources returned a non-zero exit code.

semver.json.title: Semantic Version
semver.json.description:
A valid semantic version (semver) string.

For reference, see https://semver.org/
semver.json.patternErrorMessage:
Invalid value, must be a semantic version like `<major>.<minor>.<patch>`, such as `1.2.3`.

The value may also include pre-release version information and build metadata.
semver.json.$comment:
A valid semantic version ([semver][01]) string.

This value uses the [suggested regular expression][02] to validate whether the string is valid
semver. This is the same pattern, made multi-line for easier readability:

```regex
^(0|[1-9]\d*)\.(0|[1-9]\d*)\.(0|[1-9]\d*)
(?:-(
  (?:0|[1-9]\d*|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*)
  (?:\.(?:0|[1-9]\d*|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*))
*))?
(?:\+([0-9a-zA-Z-]+(?:\.[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)*))?$
```

The first line matches the `major.minor.patch` components of the version. The middle lines match
the pre-release components. The last line matches the build metadata component.

[01]: https://semver.org/
[02]: https://semver.org/#is-there-a-suggested-regular-expression-regex-to-check-a-semver-string

instanceName.json.title: Instance name
instanceName.json.description: The short, human-readable name for a DSC Resource instance. Must be unique within a DSC Configuration document. Must be a non-empty string containing only letters, numbers, and spaces.
instanceName.json.patternErrorMessage:
Invalid value for instance name. An instance name must be a non-empty string containing only
letters, numbers, and spaces.
instanceName.json.markdownDescription:
***
[_Online Documentation_][01]
***

Defines the short, human-readable name for a DSC Resource instance. This property must be unique
within a DSC Configuration document. If any resource instances share the same name, DSC raises an
error.

The instance name must be a non-empty string containing only letters, numbers, and spaces.

[01]: https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/dsc/reference/schemas/config/resource?view=dsc-3.0&preserve-view=true#name

resourceType.json.title: DSC Resource fully qualified type name
resourceType.json.description:
The namespaced name of the DSC Resource, using the syntax:

owner[.group][.area]/name

For example:

  - Microsoft.SqlServer/Database
  - Microsoft.SqlServer.Database/User
resourceType.json.markdownDescription:
***
[_Online Documentation_][01]
***

The namespaced name of the DSC Resource, using the syntax:

```yaml
owner[.group][.area]/name
```

For example:

- `Microsoft.SqlServer/Database`
- `Microsoft.SqlServer.Database/User`

[01]: https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/dsc/reference/schemas/definitions/resourcetype?view=dsc-3.0&preserve-view=true
resourceType.json.patternErrorMessage:
Invalid type name. Valid resource type names always define an owner and a name separated by a
slash, like `Microsoft/OSInfo`. Type names may optionally include a group and area to namespace
the resource under the owner, like `Microsoft.Windows/Registry`.

message.json.title: Message
message.json.description: A message emitted by a DSC Resource with associated metadata.

name.title: Message source instance name
name.description: The short, human-readable name for the instance that emitted the message, as defined in the DSC Configuration Document.

message.title: Message content
message.description: The actual content of the message as emitted by the DSC Resource.

level.title: Message level
level.description: Indicates the severity of the message.
